intro: Siphoneranthemum sessile, commonly known as the sessile siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to dry environments and often thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
